availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles B. Anderson (Maysville (Mason County), KY, hardware merchant)

body.p: Maysville, Kentucky, hardware merchant. Kentucky native. Married to George Ann Gulick Anderson in Mason County in December 1848. Father of Frances "Fanny" C. Anderson. Married Bell Anderson. Father of Ann Anderson. Merchant in Maysville in 1850. Hardware merchant in Maysville in 1860. Merchant in Maysville in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 32A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, 3rd Ward Maysville, p. 337.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville Ward No. 4, p. 439A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mason County Marriages, 1796-1946, Film #000281843, p. 98.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Kentucky, 9th Congressional District, Vol. 3, October 1863, p. 2, p. 5 of microfilm, (Accessed via ancestry.com on May 20, 2020).
Find A Grave, "Charles Bingley Anderson (1824-1897)," Memorial 157574909, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/157574909 (accessed May 20, 2020).
